text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC, 350ºF, Gas 4. Prepare the baking trays or sheets by lining with baking (parchment) paper. Beat the butter and sugar together. When they form a light, fluffy mix, they're done. Add the cherries, ginger, orange peel, flaked almonds, chopped walnuts and ginger to the bowl. Mix well. Sift in the flour. Add the ground ginger as well and stir thoroughly. Spoon the cookie dough in even blobs on the baking trays. Since these cookies are designed to spread, keep plenty of space between them, having about four cookies per baking tray. Flatten with back of a fork or spatula. Place the cookies into the preheated oven. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven. Wet a fork and flatten them while shaping them into neat rounds. Place the flattened cookies back into the oven. Bake for another 3-4 minutes. They're ready when golden brown in colour. Remove from the oven and allow to cool in on the baking trays for 2 minutes. This will help to firm them. Then turn out on a wire cooling rack. Once completely cooled, spread half the cookies with the plain chocolate. Then spread the other half with the white chocolate. Allow to set. Serve. They make an excellent addition to an afternoon tea.
